title: Create a package using epiverse/packagetemplate
text: Go epiverse-trace/packagetemplate GH Click Use template, Create new repository Name repo click Create repository Clone repo developer machine Install dev dependency {etdev} using pak::pak("epiverse-trace/etdev") Run devtools::load_all() check errors Update DESCRIPTION NAMESPACE files Start developing Replace packagetemplate package name tests/testthat.R file

title: Create a package using epiverse/packagetemplate
text: Codecov, sign account follow instructions set Recon. Used image instead repo image appear broken might temporary. Updated render_readme.yml adding trailing -- git diff-index --quiet HEAD -- line 87. Based reference Also found GH Action logs script didn’t permission commit build README.md file repo. fixed allowing workflow permission read/write GH repo > Actions > General (scroll bottom)

title: Create a package using epiverse/packagetemplate
text: Include brand guide {hexstickers repo} Update package template README.md steps start build package [x] Fix README.Rmd fig.path = "man/figures/README-", linter message Fix issue rendered README.md updated website Fix issues raised goodpractice::gp()
code: # from dev-utils.R file # This unexported function adds a custom item to `usethis::use_release_issue()` release_bullets <- function() {    c(     "Run `goodpractice::gp()`",     "Review [WORDLIST](https://docs.cran.dev/spelling#wordlist)"   )  }

what: Convert words to numbers in multiple languages
title: Convert words to numbers in multiple languages
text: numberize R package convert numbers written English, French Spanish words "zero" "nine hundred ninety nine trillion, nine hundred ninety nine billion, nine hundred ninety nine million, nine hundred ninety nine thousand, nine hundred ninety nine" character string numeric value. numberize developed Centre Mathematical Modelling Infectious Diseases London School Hygiene Tropical Medicine part Epiverse-TRACE program.

title: Convert words to numbers in multiple languages
text: can install development version numberize GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("epiverse-trace/numberize") #>  #> → Will update 1 package. #> → The package (0 B) is cached. #> + numberize 0.0.1 → 0.0.1 [bld][cmp] (GitHub: 8f0650a) #>  #> ℹ No downloads are needed, 1 pkg is cached #> ✔ Got numberize 0.0.1 (source) (31.88 kB) #> ℹ Packaging numberize 0.0.1 #> ✔ Packaged numberize 0.0.1 (342ms) #> ℹ Building numberize 0.0.1 #> ✔ Built numberize 0.0.1 (930ms) #> ✔ Installed numberize 0.0.1 (github::epiverse-trace/numberize@8f0650a) (25ms) #> ✔ 1 pkg: upd 1, dld 1 (NA B) [4.2s] library("numberize")

title: Convert words to numbers in multiple languages
text: examples illustrate current functionality.
code: # numberize a French string numberize("zéro",  lang = "fr") #> [1] 0  # numberize a Spanish string numberize("Siete mil quinientos cuarenta y cinco", lang = "es") #> [1] 7545  # numberize the English string "nine hundred and ninety-nine trillion, nine hundred and ninety-nine billion, nine hundred and ninety-nine million, nine hundred and ninety-nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine" # nolint: line_length_linter. formatC(numberize("nine hundred and ninety-nine trillion, nine hundred and ninety-nine billion, nine hundred and ninety-nine million, nine hundred and ninety-nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine"), big.mark = ",", format = "fg") # nolint: line_length_linter. #> [1] "999,999,999,999,999"  # some edge cases numberize("veintiún", lang = "es") #> [1] 21 numberize("veintiuno", lang = "es") #> [1] 21

title: Convert words to numbers in multiple languages
text: {numberwang} converts numbers words vice versa. Limitation: English , CRAN. {nombre} converts numerics words. Limitation: English , word number conversion. {english} converts numerics words. Limitation: English , word number conversion. {spanish} converts numbers words vice versa. Limitation: Spanish . numberize released standalone package hope useful R community large. numberize created response data cleaning requirements {cleanepi}.

title: Generate a numeric vector from text in a supported language. — digits_from
Generate a numeric vector from text in a supported language. — digits_from
text: text Word(s) spell numbers. e.g. "one", "deux", "trois" lang text's language. Currently one "en" | "fr" | "es".

title: Generate a numeric vector from text in a supported language. — digits_from
text: numeric vector.

title: Generate a numeric vector from text in a supported language. — digits_from
code: if (FALSE) { digits_from("five hundred and thirty eight") # [1]   5 100  30   8 }

what:
Generate a number from a numeric vector.
Uses digits_from() output to generate the numeric value of the text. — number_from
